questions.title: Question 1: IPv4 bit length
questions.body: How many bits does IPv4 require?
questions.explanation: IPv4 addresses are 32-bit numbers (usually shown as 4 octets).

questions.title: Question 2: Paging vs Segmentation
questions.body: Which statement correctly contrasts paging and segmentation?
options: Paging uses fixed-size blocks and avoids external fragmentation; segmentation uses variable-sized segments and can cause external fragmentation.
Paging uses variable-sized blocks; segmentation uses fixed-size frames.
Paging and segmentation are the same; both use fixed-size pages.
questions.explanation: Paging divides memory into fixed-size pages and frames which simplifies allocation and avoids external fragmentation. Segmentation divides memory into logical variable-sized segments and can lead to external fragmentation.
